text: Zar of the Khazag
The High Zar of the Khazag tribe chases his ultimate ambition.
His faith? That of those who will forever be considered the antagonist.
The Neverchosen
Cunning and vile, yet useful enough to teach Thorgar valueable lessons of the arcane.
Sudobaal's Teachings
The chant can be heared from a long distance and strikes fear in the hearts of many a tribe.
Chant of the Khazag
His bloodcry signals the ultimate frenzy as blood flows freely, the bludgeon howls in comfort.
Thorgar's Bloodcry
A warmace so devestating it is rumoured to be forged by some Chaos God.
Howling Warmace
The mutated beasts of the steppes provide iron like furs, useful for any warmongering tribe of marauders.
Furs of the Steppes
The Khazag are driven onward by the ambition of their High Zar.
The Khazag Tribe
Fed only with meat and starved before battle, the mammoths of the Khazag tribe perform unnaturally in battle.
Unnatural Carnivores
Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.
Marauder Chariot

Marauder Chariot
This highly ornate suit of Chaos Armour shimmered with unnatural energies that distorted the position of the wearer so that an enemy's blows missed their mark
Armour of damnation
Filled with the warping power of Chaos, the Ring of Change could transform an attacker into a slavering Chaos Spawn.
Ring of Change
